channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pope to be admitted to hospital for bronchitis
item.description: The Pope has had bronchitis symptoms for several days leading to other officials reading his speeches.

item.title: Why do we celebrate Valentine's Day and who was Saint Valentine?
item.description: Happy Valentine's Day! Learn more about its history and what it's all about in 2025.

item.title: DR Congo singer killed filming video in conflict city
item.description: Delcat Idengo, well-known for his songs critical of all sides in the fighting, died in Goma.

item.title: Chernobyl radiation shield hit by Russian drone, Ukraine says
item.description: There has been no increase in radiation levels at the plant this morning, Ukraine's president says.

item.title: Inside the origins of modern Valentine's Day celebrations
item.description: Valentine's cards and gifts have their roots in English traditions — but Americans have long embraced them for romantic partners and other loved ones.

item.title: Video shows whale swallow kayaker, spit him out: "I thought I was dead"
item.description: A humpback whale briefly swallowed a kayaker in Chile, before spitting him out unharmed, an amazing escape that was all captured on video.

item.title: Eating yogurt regularly may reduce the risk of colon cancer, a study finds
item.description: Humans have been eating yogurt for millennia. Ancient texts reference its health-promoting properties. Now a new study finds yogurt may reduce the ris...

item.title: New poll shows more support for immigration restrictions. And, this week in DOGE
item.description: Despite divisions over Trump's immigration crackdowns, Americans show growing support for immigration restrictions. And, several top federal prosecuto...

item.title: A federal worker tried to take Trump's 'Fork' resignation offer. Here's what happened
item.description: Liz Goggin, a social worker with the Veterans Health Administration, took the offer to resign in exchange for pay and benefits through September. Then...

item.title: Including people without legal status in census has had little impact on House seats, study finds
Southern California hit by destructive debris flows caused by heavy rains
item.description: Southern California faces the continued risk of rock and mudslides on wildfire-scarred hillsides after heavy rains sent debris across several roadways...

item.title: What we know about suspected car attack in Munich
item.description: A 24-year-old Afghan asylum seeker drove at a group of people and injured at least 28, German police say.

item.title: Pope Francis being hospitalized for bronchitis and testing, Vatican says
item.description: Pope Francis was to be hospitalized for bronchitis treatment and necessary diagnostic testing after his Friday audiences, the Vatican said.

item.title: Which dog breed got robbed — AGAIN — at Westminster? Find out in the quiz!
item.description: This week, we've got little kids, loser dogs, the Super Bowl, '90s power ballads and too much government.

item.title: Dentist charged in wife's poisoning death allegedly tried to kill detective
item.description: James Craig is accused of poisoning Angela Craig's protein shakes nearly two years ago, but his trial has been delayed.

item.title: LA vehicle swept into ocean as rain hits fire-ravaged area
item.description: Debris and mud flow pushes a fire department car into the Pacific as a rainstorm lashed LA county.

item.title: Can suspending a cage-free egg law solve the soaring price problem? Nevada takes a crack at it
An Israeli raid of a famous Palestinian bookstore stokes censorship fears
item.description: A famous Palestinian-owned bookstore in East Jerusalem was raided by Israeli police, stoking fears of increased censorship.
